intro: Cola fibrillosa, commonly known as the fibrous cola, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds covered in fine, fibrous hairs.
